question_text: A technician installs two 8 GB DDR5 modules into a DDR4 motherboard. What outcome is expected?
answer_options: System runs with limited memory capacity
System will not POST due to physical incompatibility
correct_answer: System will not POST due to physical incompatibility
explanation: DDR5 and DDR4 are not backward-compatible. The keying notch ensures physical installation is impossible, and the system will not function even if bypassed.
